The decision to step down, according to Google executives, is about streamlining management. ''As Google has grown, managing the business has become more complicated,'' wrote Eric Schmidt in a blog post on Thursday. So Larry, Sergey Brin and I have been talking for a long time about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making, and over the holidays we decided now was the right moment to make some changes to the way we are structured. Eric Schmidt 's tenure at Google has been nothing short of extraordinary. Barack Obama Kirsten Gillibrand told US television on Sunday she had visited Gabrielle Giffords the previous day and found her ''doing great'' and ''making progress every day.'' Gabrielle Giffords is using both sides of her body. She's able to breathe on her own. She's able to open her eyes and to show people she understands what she's hearing and seeing, Kirsten Gillibrand told NBC's Meet The Press program.
